alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 21 at 5:23PM AKST until January 22 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL PANHANDLE... .Snowfall rates have increased across the central panhandle through Sunday morning with higher ratios. This resulted in the onset time to begin earlier, a longer duration snowfall, and thus higher total accumulations. Dry snow will become wetter through the event with southern areas transitioning to rain. For northern areas, it is possible that snow lasts longer Monday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 18 to 22 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dry snow is accumulating quickly with 4 to 7 inches measured across the area as of mid day. Snow is expected to increase in water content through Monday and compact snow on the ground. Boat owners are encouraged to check on their vessels.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
